image.altText: Police officers stand on a street verge behind blue and white crime scene tape

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian man has been released under a community supervision order after being found not guilty, due to insanity, of attempting to murder his housemate.

title.children: Man who believed podcast told him to stab housemate released under community supervision

image.altText: Three children: JayBird Byrne, Lani and Luca.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australian kids experience 'school can't'. For these families, finding a system that works has transformed their child's life.

title.children: 'Unschooling' kids are thriving after leaving the classroom

image.altText: Small orange fish next to a ruler that indicates they are only a couple of millimeters long.

props.synopsis: They may look a little like popcorn, but these baby red handfish are giving hope for the species' survival.

title.children: At just a few millimetres in length, tiny handfish babies delight scientists

image.altText: Man using an adapted mountain bike, second man on a mountain bike behind him on a track.

props.synopsis: When Gordon Broome took up adapted mountain biking during his rehabilitation, it set him on a path to help others do the same.

title.children: Adapted mountain biking makes wilderness accessible for paraplegic riders

image.altText: Cheryl Willie with husband Terry and their Christmas-themed tractor display.

props.synopsis: Santa's sleigh being pulled by dirt bikes. Santa on a tractor. Santa sitting on a dunny, with an elf alongside. The roadside Christmas displays in this very out-of-the-way town are worth the trip.

title.children: Tiny Tassie town puts itself 'on the map' with festive displays

image.altText: Rob McEwan looks over with plans for construction laid out on a desk in an office.

props.synopsis: After workers dug up two skeletons at a Hobart school's hockey field it was believed there'd likely be more. But the scale of what the archaeological team found was staggering.

title.children: Did you miss? 📣 Nearly 2,000 bodies found under school's sporting field, in what is believed to be Australia's biggest exhumation

image.altText: An old man in a suit walks with his male lawyer amongst a media scrum.

props.synopsis: The 83-year-old has denied all alleged historical offences of indecent assault and sexual touching.

title.children: 'Baseless or they distort the truth': Alan Jones breaks silence on charges

image.altText: Australia batter Nathan McSweeney stands in the Gabba outfield under cloudy skies during a Test against India.

props.synopsis: Travis Head ends India's resolute 10th-wicket partnership with a 185-run lead, before another rain delay halts Australia's bid to win the third Test on day five at the Gabba. Follow live.

title.children: 'Severe weather' warning at the Gabba threatens Australia's push for victory

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: India all out for 260, trail by 185

image.altText: Hugh Marks

props.synopsis: Hugh Marks's ascension to the top of the media pile was not via the traditional route. Now he has one of Australia's toughest assignments.

title.children: Hugh Marks merged Nine and Fairfax. Now he's poised to lead the ABC

image.altText: Two men whose faces are obscured walk up to a nurse's station at a hospital.

props.synopsis: Mike* has an acquired brain injury and schizoaffective disorder, he is also the recipient of an NDIS plan worth $660,000 a year — making him a lucrative catch for unscrupulous providers.

title.children: Family of NDIS participant fears he's been 'kidnapped' for $670k plan

image.altText: Generic photo of people swimming in the ocean at an Adelaide beach on a hot day.

props.synopsis: Christmas Day is looking dry and sunny for most of the country, with a distinctive lack of rain-producing low-pressure systems, troughs or cold fronts appearing on the charts.

title.children: Warm Christmas Day forecast for most of Australia with heatwave to follow

image.altText: A booking photograph of Luigi Mangione at State Correctional Institution

props.synopsis: Accused CEO killer Luigi Mangione committed an act of domestic terrorism when he fatally shot a healthcare executive in Manhattan, US authorities allege.

title.children: Luigi Mangione charged with terrorism, NYPD slams public 'celebration'

image.altText: A line-up of cars on a road that is partially underwater.

props.synopsis: The dams are spilling, the ground is sodden, and more rain is on the way for parts of Queensland, so is it time to fear another major flood event?

title.children: Queenslanders urged not to panic but prepare for possible floods

image.altText: the wind blows balck and yellow flags with yellow writing attached to fences of building sites with buildings behind

props.synopsis: The Victorian government has accepted all of the recommendations of a report into unlawful activity and corruption at government construction sites.

title.children: New complaints mechanism for Victoria's 'rotten' construction sector

image.altText: A mother giving her daughter pills out of a square bottle.

props.synopsis: A major review of evidence on ADHD treatment in adults has found stimulant drugs and one type of non-stimulant are the only effective treatments for reducing core symptoms in the short term.

title.children: ADHD drugs reduce symptoms in adults but don't improve quality of life, study finds

image.altText: The silhouettes of a military vehicle and soldier against an orange sunset sky along the Gaza border.

props.synopsis: Hamas, Israel and the United States have indicated a deal could be close that would allow for the first truce between the warring sides since late last year.

title.children: Optimism as Israel and Hamas hold 'serious and positive' truce talks

image.altText: a skyline with houses

props.synopsis: Australians reselling their properties made record profits in the September quarter, according to CoreLogic. Australian stocks have opened flat. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: Record profits for Australians selling property, ASX flat

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Local shares pushing higher at lunch
Nissan and Honda exploring possible merger
Qantas compensation 'a huge relief' for workers, Chalmers says

image.altText: A woman hugs her dog, with a tent in the background.

props.synopsis: The City of Moreton Bay issues a blanket ban forbidding homeless people from owning pets or publicly sleeping in vans.

title.children: Queensland council bans pets for rough sleepers amid homeless crackdown

image.altText: The region spanning the sky from the constellation of Sagittarius (the Archer) to Scorpius (the Scorpion).

props.synopsis: A group of international researchers discover a binary star orbiting near a supermassive black hole at the centre of our galaxy, the Milky Way.

title.children: Binary star found orbiting supermassive black hole at galaxy's centre

image.altText: Woman sitting in room with blue background

props.synopsis: A mother of two is calling for better training of psychologists after her ex-partner confessed to wanting to kill himself and their children.

title.children: Mother claims therapist ignored ex-husband's filicide warning signs

image.altText: A middle-aged bald man in a military uniform speaks while seated behind a name plaque.

props.synopsis: Lieutenant General Igor Kirillov, who served as chief of Russia's nuclear defence forces, was recently accused by Ukraine of being responsible for the use of chemical weapons against Ukrainian troops.

title.children: Ukraine behind 'bomb in scooter' assassination of top Russian general

image.altText: Brunette haired woman with bandage over missing nose

props.synopsis: In Australia, anyone needing a facial prosthetic, such as a nose or ear, must pay for it themselves. However, those below the neck can be paid for through government funding or private health insurance.

title.children: Cancer survivor can't afford new nose under prosthetics funding rules

image.altText: Hands holding bottle of ArmaForce.

props.synopsis: Australia's Therapeutic Goods Administration has an ongoing investigation into a key ingredient of ArmaForce, which is believed to have triggered several adverse reactions.

title.children: Popular cold and flu treatment ArmaForce under investigation by TGA

image.altText: A man celebrates after winning an MMA fight

props.synopsis: The UFC's next visit to Australia is beginning to take shape, with two Australian up-and-comers added to the UFC 312 event to be held in Sydney in February.

title.children: Australian duo Jenkins and Nolan added to Sydney UFC card

image.altText: A ship in the ocean.

props.synopsis: Japanese officials claim their Mogami frigate is faster, stealthier and better suited to operate alongside the United States than a rival warship offering from Germany.

title.children: Faster and stealthier: Japan's pitch to clinch $10bn Australian warship prize

image.altText: Pat Cummins walks off the Gabba with his teammates behind him

props.synopsis: Australia arrived at the Gabba on day four needing to force the issue for everything to fall their way for a victory to be snatched, but as the misfortunes piled up the day quickly came to represent a missed opportunity.

title.children: On a day Australia needed everything to go right, too much went wrong

image.altText: Josh Hazlewood prepares to bowl during day three of the third Test between Australia and India at the Gabba.

props.synopsis: Australia expects Pat Cummins and Mitchell Starc to play through the home summer unchanged after Josh Hazlewood's injury made their availability crucial.

title.children: Aussies back Cummins, Starc to carry bowling load in Hazlewood's absence

image.altText: Bluey jumps in the air happily

props.synopsis: The Queensland series has become one of the most watched television shows around the world.

title.children: Bluey movie to hit cinema screens in 2027

image.altText: Several people sleeping and lying on floor in prison

props.synopsis: Under proposed law changes, drug users in Indonesia could be sent to rehabilitation centres instead of prison. But legal experts say the change will simply shift a problem.

title.children: Indonesia to take new approach to dealing with drug users

image.altText: A black and white photo of a young boy leaning on the railing of a rodeo, with a crowd of people seated behind him.

props.synopsis: With D-day looming, the Mount Isa Rodeo has been granted a lifeline, but it may not be enough.

title.children: Christmas gift might save the largest rodeo in southern hemisphere

image.altText: Close-up of a green Medicare card with a calculator and money in the background

props.synopsis: Last year, the government tripled bulk-billing incentives for some people, but doctors did not claim all the benefits. Here's why.

title.children: GPs leave $140 million in Medicare incentives unclaimed

image.altText: A happy family smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: A dying Queensland mother living with cystic fibrosis has again cheated death with a heart and double lung transplant.

title.children: Queensland mother on transplant list for just six hours before life-saving call

image.altText: drone view of a cotton field

props.synopsis: Grapes, cotton and grains are blooming out of Queensland's desert red dirt, prompting the beginning of a brand new industry. But can the dusty outback become more than just grazing land?

title.children: Unexpected crops blooming in Queensland's dusty cattle country

image.altText: A hand holding a police device/wand.

props.synopsis: Western Australia's new knife laws, which the government says are the "toughest" in the country, are set to take effect on Friday. So what do they mean for you?

title.children: 'Anytime, anywhere': New knife laws to take effect this Friday

image.altText: By the beach is a girl with hair past her shoulders wearing circular sunnies and holding an electric guitar pointing to the sky.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australian kids experience 'school can't'. For these families, finding a system that works has transformed their child's life.

title.children: 'Unschooling' kids are thriving after leaving the classroom
